answers.author: Gwendolyn Mungin
answers.text:
The Public  Works Department uses GPS technology on their vehicles to improve service delivery and efficiency only.  Our intent was not to reduce the size of the fleet, but to enhance service delivery, time and cost-wise. The technology has been invaluable.

From Chip Boyles via ICMA's Facebook fan page (we hope to have them completely linked soon):
Check out City of Clemson SC pinpoint geotech gps system. They use gps devices in garbage trucks to delineate special pick ups of debris, white goods, leaves, etc. This elinates the need to take calls or send trucks out canvassing for piles. Police cars are equipped to delineate outer street lights, potholes, sidewalk disrepair, etc.
